reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 17, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars I love this and my kids too
reviews.reviewText: I recently acquired the RG35XX Linux Handheld and Garlic Handheld Game Console, and it stands out for its practical features. The 3.5'' IPS screen provides clear visuals without unnecessary frills, and the inclusion of dual SD card slots offers expanded storage options for a variety of games.The Linux operating system adds flexibility, allowing users to explore different gaming options and install custom ROMs. Navigating through the menu and games is straightforward, making it easy to enjoy a range of titles without unnecessary complexities.The handheld design is comfortable for extended gaming sessions, with responsive controls and a sturdy build. The dual SD card slots provide users with the freedom to store a variety of games without worrying about space constraints.The inclusion of the Garlic OS enables a selection of classic games. The portable design makes it suitable for gaming on the go, providing entertainment during travel or downtime.In summary, the RG35XX Linux Handheld and Garlic Handheld Game Console, with its practical features like a 3.5'' IPS screen and dual SD card slots, offers a sensible and customizable gaming solution. Whether you're a fan of classic games or prefer exploring new titles, this handheld console strikes a balance between functionality and nostalgia. Recommended for those seeking a straightforward gaming experience with customization options.Honestly, i think it's one of the best portable console for retro games (up to PS1)

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 21, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great system for kids of all ages
reviews.reviewText: I ordered my RG35XX over a week ago and received it last week. I had been watching videos and reading reviews and felt like it would be perfect for me. I grew up on NES, Game Boy, and SNES, and really only needed something that could do those consoles, but liked to have flexibility to go up to other systems like Dreamcast and Playstation. Initial reviews of the RG35XX were mixed; the stock firmware was choppy and had several QoL features missing (suspend/resume and a robust configuration option). I ordered when I saw that a new firmware, GarlicOS, was released and was having lots of positive reviews. I played the RG35XX for a couple of hours on stock firmware but decided I would really just want to get GarlicOS running.I'm glad I did! Garlic works great on the system and it's really easy to navigate and use. The form factor of the device is just perfect for me. I got the one stylized like the original Game Boy and it feels really great, very close to the original. It's smaller in the hands with a bigger screen, but it's not TOO small like the Miyoo Mini (in my opinion) nor too bulky. It's portable enough to take with you in a case, throw it in a bag, etc., and the battery life is decent. Because it has trigger buttons, it can play the newer generation games, but I've been having too much fun playing NES and Game Boy games to need them. But they are very comfortable to use.I strongly recommend this to anyone looking to see what all the fuss is about for retro handhelds. This has an easy entry into the market, isn't terribly expensive, but has good build quality and style, and enough performance to play anything a child of the 80s and 90s would want.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 3, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars This is AMAZING
reviews.reviewText: After searching so long and trying different retro emulators etc THIS is amazing. I included photos of gear and the item during game play. A lot of people take a lot of time to figure out how to utilize the wired and wireless options.Update: there’s a Bluetooth receiver available on Amazon that you can hook up to a usbc-usb adapter and this will allow you to use a Bluetooth remote like the 8bit retro controllers perfectly. You may need to map some of them keys but yeah. Strictly speaking the 2.4ghz remotes I was unsuccessful with. The buttons were completely mapped wrong or just wouldn’t work so. Down side to it.To use the tv hookup you need an hdmi/mini hdmi cable. Plugs in effortlessly and instantly connects to your tv.Wired/wireless controller usage- wired you need an older remote with usb capabilities like the pink one you see in the photos. You’ll also need a male usb-c to female usb adapter as also shown in the photos. Hook all that up and the wired controller is great. But not all controllers are equal and it depends on their wares. As for wireless, I’m still working on it, I just got this today.All in al, solid awesome piece of equipment

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 29, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Great little device
reviews.reviewText: Easy to use right out of the box, good amount of pre-included games, build quality is quite good. Some people complain about this particular device not having Wi-Fi, but for a retro console I’m not sure why that’s a problem.My only real complaint is that it seems to have trouble maintaining safe states and save files get corrupted in the Pokémon games in particular (my wife finally gave up trying to play through Yellow).All in all, I should buy a couple more of these things, they are good glorious fun and you can lend them to friends on game nights. Need a replacement anyway, my son threw it and the screen broke, but that’s my fault for letting a three-year-old get his hands on it.
Me gusto mucho. Es justo lo que esperaba. Solo que no me trabajo ningún juego de Mario Bross, y si esperaba algunos. Pero bueno, en general si es bueno.
